basics.name: Johny Serpa
basics.label: Web Developer
basics.summary:
Graduated in Hotel Management, switched career to informatics and web development. After a small (70H) course and an internship @ Ideavity, I decided I needed to get more knowledge in the area and went for graduation in it. Currently in my last year and working full time @ LVEngine, I find myself as a highly motivated professional on the pursuit of good challenges and world changing projects. 
My interest topics are: linux, javascript, nodejs, python, machine learning, blockchain, data science. 
Not that I know much about all of them, but this are topics that motivate me.

work.summary: LVEngine implements e-commerce solutions from the ERP to the Digital Marketing, passing through website design and programming.
highlights: E-commerce websites development with proprietary framework
Techs: Ionic 3, Angular, Node, PHP, Elastic Search, Linux, PostgreSQL

work.summary: Creative design studio. Small team, 2 designers and 1 programmer (me).
highlights: Development of opencart ecommerce stores, client custom business rules and design implementation
Development of well designed institutional websites and backoffice areas when needed
Some management of server settings through Cpanel and WHM
Techs: PHP, Laravel, jQuery, JavaScript, Linux, MySQL

work.summary: Three weeks work in order to help with a tight deadline quizz project for school returns. Mostly frontend.
highlights: JavaScript/jQuery code to make the quizz interactive

work.summary: While trying to learn how to code, Ideavity gave me the opportunity to be inside a tech company helping where I could. Mostly QA work, but also helping with some code.
highlights: Reviewing and testing projects before going to clients
Helping with HTML, CSS and JavaScript

volunteer.organization: MYTO - Mathare Youth Talented Organization - Kenya
volunteer.summary: I worked mainly in the MKI (Miss Kogalo Initiative) project as a project manager with a local age-mate. The project consisted in promoting the youths from the slums and giving them tools for them to develop themselves. It attracted people from all ages with beauty contests and during the contests they would also showcase their talents. We also had people to help improve their skills such as: modeling, public speaking and had open discussion about important issues on their communities.
highlights: Development of initiatives for social inclusion
Development of website for project initiative

education.institution: ISTEC - Instituto Superior de Técnologias Avançadas
